00144  * NOTE:
00145  * Any fishnet API call may abort and dump core on failure (e.g., if it is
00146  * given bad arguments).  An error message will be printed, and you can use
00147  * gdb to help you figure out what happened.

00199 /*******************************************************************
00200   This section describes the fishnet layer interactions.  All functions
00201   that accept a frame pointer must not free() the frame when they are done.
00202   Other code in libfish.a takes are of freeing the frame.  If code makes
00203   a duplicate copy of the frame, it is the code's responsibility to ensure
00204   that copy is freed correctly.
00205 
00206   The following chart shows the interactions of fishnet layers 1-4, plus the
00207   function calls that move frames up and down the fishnet stack.  The parameters
00208   to each function are documented in comments around the function's declaration.
00209 
00210 
00211              ----------------------------------
00212              |                                |
00213              |                        >=======|====> fishnode_l4_receive()
00214              |                        |       |
00215              |            Layer 4     >=======|====> fish_sendto_l4_builtin()
00216              |                        |       |
00217              |                        >=======|====> fish_sendto_l4_apps()
00218              |                        |       |
00219              ----------------------------------
00220                              v        ^ fish_l4_receive()
00221                              |        |
00222                              v        ^-----------------
00223                              |                         ^
00224              fish_l3_send()  v                         |
00225              ----------------------------------        ^
00226              |               |                |        |
00227              |   fish_l3_forward()    >=======|====> fishnode_l3_receive()
00228              |               v        |       |
00229              |  Layer 3      |        >=======|====> fish_sendto_l2_builtin()
00230              |               v        |       |
00231              |               |        >=======|====> fish_sendto_l2_apps()
00232              |               v        |       |
00233              ----------------------------------
00234                              v        ^ fish_l3_receive()
00235                              |        |
00236                              v        ^----------------
00237                              |                        ^
00238              fish_l2_send()  v                        |
00239              ----------------------------------       ^
00240              |                                |       |
00241              |                        >=======|===> fishnode_l2_receive()
00242              |                        |       |
00243              |            Layer 2     >=======|===> fish_sendto_l2_builtin()
00244              |                        |       |
00245              |                        >=======|===> fish_sendto_l2_apps()
00246              |                        |       |
00247              ----------------------------------
00248                              v        ^ fish_l2_receive()
00249                              |        |
00250                              v        ^
00251                              |        |
00252              fish_l1_send()  v        ^ 
00253              ----------------------------------
00254              |                                |
00255              |            Layer 1             |
00256              |     (libfish.a / fishhead)     |
00257              ----------------------------------
00258 
00259 
00260    Each fishnode_l*_receive() function should only un-encapsulate and pass
00261    frames up the network stack that are destined for the fishnode (e.g., either
00262    a unicast, multicast, or broadcast packet for this node).
00263 */
00264

00534 extern struct FishnetL4Funcs {
00535    int (*fish_l4_receive)(void *l4frame,     /* Frame that is being received,
00536                                                 including the L4+ headers. */
00537                           int len,           /* length of the L4 frame */
00538                           uint8_t proto,     /* The fishnet protocol number of
00539                                                 the L4 protocol. */
00540                           fnaddr_t src);     /* The source L3 fishnet address of
00541                                                 the node that sent the packet. 
00542                                               */
00543    int (*fishnode_l4_receive)(void *l4frame, /* Frame that is being received,
00544                                                 including the L4+ headers. */
00545                           int len,           /* length of the L4 frame */
00546                           uint8_t proto,     /* The fishnet protocol number of
00547                                                 the L4 protocol. */
00548                           fnaddr_t src);     /* The source L3 fishnet address of
00549                                                 the node that sent the packet. 
00550                                               */
00551                                              /* NOTE: This function may be NULL
00552                                               * if the fishnode does not need to
00553                                               * process L4 frames */
00554 } fish_l4;

00571                                               */

01137 extern struct fishnet_name_functions {
01138    /* This function gets called when a name packet arrives.  It is normally
01139     * called by the libfish.a code, however if you provide your own function
01140     * implementation then libfish will NOT automatically call it.
01141     */
01142    void (*name_received)(void *l4frame,   /* A pointer to the first byte of the
01143                                              name L4 payload
01144                                              */
01145                        uint16_t len,      /* The length of the L4 payload */
01146                        fnaddr_t src);     /* The src address of the node sending
01147                                              the name packet */
01148 } fish_name;
